results.title: Ivan's childhood = Ivanovo Detstvo [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Andrei Tarkovsky, G Natanson and Mosfilm
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Films of the great victory 1941-1945”.
Tarkovsky’s prize-winning debut feature is an extraordinarily moving view of war and revenge. Twelve year-old Ivan is determined to avenge his mother’s death, and he joins a Russian regiment as a scout. His ability to slip through enemy lines more easily than an adult makes him useful to the army, but, as his missions become increasingly dangerous, it is decided that he must be removed from the front line. Ivan resists and convinces his commanding officers to allow him to carry out one last expedition. The monochrome photography depicts Ivan’s war in a series of memorable sequences, and contributes to making this film one of cinema’s great statements on war. Also available on VHS [311666].

results.title: The Star = Zvezda
results.creator_credit: Nikolai Lebedev, Karen Shakhnazarov and Mosfilm
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Films of the great victory 1941-1945”.
Based on the book by Emmanuil Kazakevich, this film focuses on a group of Russian scouts in WW2, aiming to penetrate Nazi communications and thwart a major attack. Echoing the themes of Steven Spielberg’s “Saving Private Ryan” (2000), director Nikolai Lebedev presents war as chaotic, taxing and disorienting. At times quite claustrophobic, the film works best when presenting the dangerously fraught reconnaissance missions undertaken by the unit.

results.title: Destiny of a man = Sudba cheloveka
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Films of the great victory 1941-1945”.
Melancholy and sympathetic view of the tragedies suffered by a family man and WW2 POW survivor. Haunted by his experiences in a concentration camp the man has survived this appalling event by clinging to the hope of reuniting with his wife and child. Directed by, and also starring Sergei Bondarchuk, this was a successful film that with its unstinting humanism, proved the ability of Russian filmmakers to combine cinematic beauty with compassionate sentiment.

results.title: Ballad of a soldier = Ballada o soldate
results.creator_credit: Grigori Chukhrai, M Chernova and Mosfilm
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Films of the great victory 1941-1945”.
Amid the chaos of WW2, a young Russian soldier earns a pass home, for an act of heroism. En route he is detained constantly, as he helps others on their way, managing only the briefest of encounters with his forlorn mother, before returning to active duty. This acclaimed drama speaks of the hardship of war as experienced by the Russian people and of the sadness of separation. It also depicts the sensuality of youth, a theme previously denied Russian filmmakers, but allowed during the “thaw” as it was known, a period in the 1950s of Soviet cinema.
results.title_for_label: Ballad of a soldier = Ballada o soldate

This acclaimed drama speaks of the hardship of war as experienced by the Russian people and of the sadness of separation. It also depicts the sensuality of youth, a theme previously denied Russian filmmakers, but allowed during the “thaw” as it was known, a period in the 1950s of Soviet cinema.

results.title: M.2-16mm 2T splicer
results.brief_description:
The splicer, afterwards simply know as the “Catozzo”, was born as a result of a serious form of allergy to the smell of the cement suffered by his inventor which produced the happy intuition to use adhesive tape in its place, for joining the various film ends together.
This idea was subsequently consolidated and patented all over the world, developing into all the various currently existing models. [SOURCE: https://www.cir-srl.com/ last accessed 20/06/2019]

CIR (Costruzione Incollatrici Rapide) Catozzo

Incollatrice M. 2-16mm 2T splicer
with adhesive tape
housed in original cardbox box.

Housed in storage box stamped three times with:
Michael Hudson
Phone 387 4549
Film Production & design
626 Park Street
North Carlton VIC 3054

Included are: Instructions per film 16mm
description of splicers flier that folds out.
Made in Italy. Patented

Label at the bottom of the splicer has been attached which says:
Michael Hudson
Phone 387 4549
Film Production & design
626 Park Street
North Carlton VIC 3054

Inscribed at the base: Made in Italy. US pat

silver label at the base reads:
made in Italy by
Officine Meccaniche
Dr. Leo Catozzo
00050 Santa Severa (Roma)
Tel. 0766/78008-78181

FPB A-2025

results.title: 70mm cement splicer
results.brief_description:
70mm cement splicer
Richard Brown donation
Made from cast iron and the paint is noticeably flaking off. There is still film in the splicer. There is still a piece of blank film inside it.
